author: m.kalinin
content: Should we rename Consensus API to Engine API? I am fine with this if it will reduce the degree of confusion

author: m.kalinin
content: And what do you think about "Execution" API which might be more sound?

author: m.kalinin
content: What kind of? Execution engine/client exposes Execution API which is an interface to the execution layer. This is how I would use this term.

author: protolambda
content:
API name proposal;
- Execution API - the JSON RPC used in Eth1 today (all the web3 commons, but also has a miner and clique namespace, so let's not use "consensus" in APIs to avoid confusion)
- Engine API - the new merge API to enable a beacon node (or rollup) to use the execution client as an engine (process blocks with EVM and update state, and reorg forkchoice)
- Beacon API - the REST-JSON API used in Eth2 today (has a beacon namespace, and optional validator namespace, and misc beacon-node info)

author: m.kalinin
content: Oh, I see. I have missed the moment when Ethereum JSON-RPC turned into Execution API. Why would we want to rename JSON-RPC?

author: protolambda
content: If the engine API also uses the JSON-RPC format, then it gets confusing

author: m.kalinin
content: Isn't the level of decoupling that is provided by using separate documents and separate namespaces for these APIs enough? They will also be exposed on different ports. TBH, I don't see how the usage of the same format may increase the confusion if everything else is done properly.

author: m.kalinin
content: Although, as we are following consensus/execution naming `beacon`/`execution` for the user's API might make sense ðŸ¤”  And we need a name for something in between which might be `engine`

author: axic3354
content:
An interesting question to consider is what will happen in wallets (the "web3 API" and the "provider API"). The web3 API started out as a mere proxy of the JSON RPC, and later it was abstracted to have a "provider API" between the Javascript library and the underlying wallet. However both follow the JSON RPC function naming of the underlying protocol.

They may choose to expose some of the new APIs, probably the `beacon` one, but I doubt they would take the `engine`.

Do you expect them to do any renaming to `execution` or just keep going with `eth_...` ?

author: axic3354
content: I assume the `execution`/`beacon`/.. is just the umbrella naming term and there are no plans to change anything within the protocol, but making this clear to dappdevs would be useful.

author: m.kalinin
content: I think that keep using `eth_...` makes more sense than unnecessary renaming that might add more confusion. Actually, we're aiming to make it with as less changes for users as it is possible and renaming APIs is what should be avoided. But we need to pick names for new API set and probably rename the existing ones to avoid confusion among developers and researchers, I guess this is what umbrella means in your case. All this is IMHO.
